Text.Value: What were you doing in the village?
Fezzerk... best raider... east o' the... Sea o' Swords...

EditorData.NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.
EditorData.SFXTags: Speak with dead spell to match VFX -   FX_SpeakWithDead_Spell_Loop

Text.Value: Are there others like you nearby?
Many... so many... legions o' goblins... an' more... serving... the Absolute...

EditorData.NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.
EditorData.SFXTags: Speak with dead spell to match VFX -   FX_SpeakWithDead_Spell_Loop

Text.Value: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

EditorData.SFXTags: Speak with dead spell to match VFX -   FX_SpeakWithDead_Spell

EditorData.NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Text.Value: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

EditorData.SFXTags: Speak with dead spell to match VFX -   FX_SpeakWithDead_Spell_LeadOut

EditorData.NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.
EditorData.SFXTags: Speak with dead spell to match VFX -   FX_SpeakWithDead_Spell_Loop

Text.Value: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

EditorData.SFXTags: Angry hiss from corpse / Speak with dead spell to match VFX - FX_SpeakWithDead_Spell

Synopsis: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.
